item.title: My husband and I are in our 50s — and 85% invested in stocks. Is our strategy too aggressive for the next 10 years?
item.description: “Our funds and our tech stocks have done well over the years.”

item.title: ‘She is financially irresponsible’: My husband secretly gives our daughter, 37, thousands of dollars. She spends the money wildly. How do I stop this?
item.description: “My husband has been giving her money each month. The deposits from October 2024 through February 2025 total almost $13,000.”

item.title: Who gets to rebuild? Los Angeles fires expose the weakness of U.S. home insurance.
item.description: Americans are being forced to reckon with the ‘new normal’ of climate change. Now what?

item.title: The end of insurance: Climate change is destroying homeowners and insurers
item.description: Traditional insurance models aren’t able to handle escalating natural disaster risks.

item.title: Trump has two strong options to defuse the U.S. debt time-bomb. He should use them.
item.description: AI-fueled productivity growth, combined with realistic and constructive immigration reform, would put the U.S. economy on more solid footing.
